channel.title: forensics on Miast.io
channel.description: Recent content in forensics on Miast.io

item.title: UofTCTF 2024 - Illusion
item.description: UofTCTF 2024 forensics/Illusion Writeup We’re given a PCAP file with a lot of traffic to and from one IP address. Looking into it, it’s mainly HTTP traffic, with some calls to a cloned Google.com page, and a GET request for an image. The requests to the images caught my interest, as they don’t return any image data, just a 200 OK. The GUID string looks like base64, but doesn’t decode to anything.

item.title: Cybergon CTF
item.description: Forensics - XIPPER This file is something wrong. Can you open it before the winter season? In this challenge we are initially given a file called xipper.PNG. Running file on the PNG shows that it is actually a ZIP file. However, when attempting to unzip the file we get the following error: $ unzip xipper.zip Archive: xipper.zip file #1: bad zipfile offset (local header sig): 0 Opening the file in a hex editor, we see the first 4 bytes are wrong.
